titleStmt.title: Daniel W. Lindsey, Special Orders No. 74
CWG14437

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteers,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE.
Frankfort, Octr 29" 1864.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
NO. 74.

Maj Chas W. Quiggins is hereby appointed Special Mustering Officer for the State, and he will proceed to Irvine -- Estill County Ky, to organize and muster in for 12 months the "Kentucky River Battalion" of the 1: Regt Capitol Guards. He will take with him all necessary supplies to arm and equip said battalion with a sufficient guard for their protection. He will report to Brigr Genl S. G. Suddarth for instructing as to the best mode of subsisting the battalion. He will remain with said battalion until it is organized and a Major appointed to the command, and report weekly to these and his Regimental Head Quarters. Before leaving he will report in person at these Head Quarters for verbal instructions and the necessary blanks.

By command of the Governor:
D. W. Lindsey
Adjutant General of Kentucky.

Maj Chas. W. Quiggens.
1 Reg Cap Gd
